Plant Facts Quiz
Time to test your knowledge of the crazy natural world!
Question 1:
Why do apples float in water and pennies sink?
Apples are witches and witches float on water.
They\'re 25% air.
Apples were genetically bred to float by the Native Americans.
"They idolize Michael Phelps and learned to swim."
Question 2:
85% of plant life is found in this place on earth …
In the rain forest.
My friend Mel\'s house, she really loves plants.
In the ocean.
That\'s impossible, 85% of plants can\'t be found in one place.
Question 3:
The first potatoes were cultivated in Peru, 7,000 – 10,000 years ago.
TRUE: You can find ancient potatoes in lakes!
FALSE: Blarney! The Irish were the first!
Question 4:
Which South American country is named after a tree?
Type your answer here …
Brazil
Question 5:
Ginko (Ginkgo biloba) is one of the oldest living tree species.
TRUE: Dinosaurs loved to plant them in their gardens.
FALSE: Ginkgo isn\'t a tree, it\'s a herb that helps with memory. Or did you forget?
Question 6:
Eating lots of onions will make you sleepy.
TRUE: Smell \'em and eat \'em before bed!
FALSE: Onions are a repellent, Janet.
Question 7:
Which tree variety is struck by lightning the most?
Maple trees.
The giant sequoia.
Oak trees.
"That's impossible, lightning doesn't descriminate."
Question 8:
Which of the follow facts about pencils are correct?
15 billion pencils are made world-wide each year.
Approximately 60,000 trees are needed to produce pencils each year.
Mechanical pencils are only sourced from Mechanical trees.
The trees needed each year to make pencils could stretch 684 miles.
Question 9:
Is a cucumber a fruit or vegetable?
Type your answer here …
fruit
Question 10:
Carrots were originally purple, not orange.
TRUE: The Dutch were mad scientists and their lab experiment blew up in their face and turned orange. The carrot gained superpowers.
FALSE: If any lab experiment goes wrong you either turn green or gain the powers of a spider, everyone knows that.
Submit your answers!
